Many law firms underestimate the importance of prompt and consistent communications with clients and prospective clients. Our team describes six simple changes you can make to the way you communicate with clients to minimize your missed opportunities and get more out of your marketing campaigns.

TIP OF THE MONTH

Use Only Offices with On-site Staff in Your GMB Listings

Google recently clarified guidelines on virtual offices. If you have a virtual office with an answering service, that will not count as an official representative of your business to qualify for a GMB page. You must have your own staff on-site.

Read More

Tech News

Amazon Cancels Plans to Build New York Headquarters

After a much-publicized process of selecting two cities for its next headquarters, Amazon announced that it would not be moving forward with one of the two cities that it had ultimately chosen. In mid-February, the internet giant officially canceled its plans to expand into the Queens borough of New York City, citing opposition from state and local politicians.

Texas Lawmaker Wants to Ban Mobile Throttling in Disaster Areas

Rep. Bobby Guerra, a member of the Texas House of Representatives, has authored a bill that would prohibit mobile internet service providers from “impair[ing] or degrad[ing] lawful mobile Internet service access in an area subject to a declared state of disaster.” This bill was in response to Verizon's throttling of a data plan used by Santa Clara County firefighters during a wildfire response in California last year, which Verizon reportedly claimed was a customer-support error. Consumers are increasingly concerned that the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) is not adequately overseeing and regulating the actions of service providers.

SpaceX Seeks FCC OK For 1 Million Satellite Broadband Earth Stations

SpaceX is reportedly seeking approval from the FCC to deploy up to one million stations to receive transmissions from the nearly 12,000 low-earth orbit satellites the FCC authorized last year. The company has stated that it aims to deploy broadband internet access throughout the United States through its satellite system.

NYPD to Google: Quit Tracking Drunk-Driving Checkpoints on Waze

The New York Police Department reportedly sent a cease-and-desist letter to Google over a feature in its Waze app that allows users to mark (and other users to subsequently see) police presence on a map. In its letter, the NYPD allegedly argues that posting the locations of DWI checkpoints may be criminal conduct.

Russia Plans to Test a Kill Switch That Disconnects the Country From the Internet

Several news outlets report that Russia is developing the infrastructure necessary to operate its own state-controlled internet service disconnected from the rest of the world. Under a program introduced last year, Russian internet providers will need to make necessary changes to remain operational if the country is cut off from the internet.

EU Copyright Directive Poised to Become Law, Includes Licensing Fees for Search Engines

The European Union is on the brink of enacting sweeping copyright legislation to change the compensation structure between content creators (such as publishers, writers, and artists) and distributors (such as search engines and news aggregators). Critics of the new law say that it will infringe on speech and negatively affect consumers and small publishers, while the law’s advocates say it provides fair compensation for content creators in this digital age.

SEO News

Report: Voice Assistants in Use to Triple to 8 Billion by 2023

Analysts at the UK-based Juniper Research firm recently predicted that the use of voice assistants will triple by 2023, from a current 2.5 billion in use in 2018 to an estimated 8 billion. The vast majority of voice assistants are available on smartphones in the form of Google Assistant for Android users and Siri on iOS. According to Juniper’s predictions, the fastest growing category for voice assistants in the coming years will be smart TVs, with an anticipated growth of over 120 percent.

Paid Search Spend Grows 10% Globally Year-Over-Year

Marin Software’s Q4 2018 Digital Advertising Benchmark Report indicates a 10% year-over-year increase in paid search spend. The financial services and retail sectors reflect the highest spending growth, at an increase of 25% and 12%, respectively. In addition to this data, the report also includes statistics on eCommerce ads and paid social monthly spending.

Are Dedicated Location Pages the Best SEO Option for SMEs?

The "Ask an SEO" column in Search Engine Journal recently addressed a question on how SMEs (small and medium enterprises) should attract customers from outside their home location. The SEO expert offered two schools of thought. One viewpoint encourages SMEs to create city-specific location pages for any areas they might want to target, even if they don’t have a physical office in those areas. The other strategy involves obtaining local links in areas in which an SME wants to generate business by interacting with and becoming members of the targeted community.

Google: Syndicated Content May Outrank the Original Source

This February, John Mueller, Webmaster Trends Analyst at Google, advised website owners that there is a trade-off when deciding to syndicate their content elsewhere on the web: the syndicated content may end up outranking its original source. According to Mueller, there are a number of factors at play in determining which version of a website’s content is most relevant for searchers, such as a canonical tag or other useful information on the site where the syndicated content is found. Moreover, Mueller notes, there is no way of guaranteeing original source content will rank above content that is syndicated.

How Google Ads is Fighting Click Fraud

Click fraud involves illegitimate actions, such as unintentional clicks or clicks that result from malicious software. Alternately referred to as ‘invalid clicks’ by Google, click fraud is a widely discussed issue because it affects advertisers on Google and other Pay-Per-Click (PPC) platforms. Since over $7 billion was lost to click fraud from 2016 to 2018, Google has devised various methods to combat it, including employing manual reviewers, the use of automated filters, and other targeted actions.

DID YOU KNOW?

AMP Can Lead to Increase in Organic Search Traffic

A recent study done by Stone Temple showed most sites (22 out of 26) saw gains in organic searches on mobile devices.

Across all 26 sites in the study, AMP resulted in:

27.1% increase in organic traffic
33.8% increase in SERP impressions
15.3% higher SERP click-through rates

If you have a Justia site, we've already enabled AMP to improve your firm's visibility online.

Social Media News

Twitter Continues Its Profit Streak, While Still Shedding Users

Twitter recently reported a 24 percent hike in fourth-quarter revenue compared to a year earlier, as well as a net income that more than doubled during the same time period. These financial gains, however, came during a drop in actual users for the third quarter in a row. There were approximately 5 million fewer users in the social network’s fourth quarter than in its third. Despite this data, Twitter’s chief executive officer Jack Dorsey focused on his company’s financial wins, stating, “2018 is proof that our long-term strategy is working.”

LinkedIn Debuts LinkedIn Live, a New Live Video Broadcast Service

In mid-February, LinkedIn launched the beta version of its live video feature, allowing the business professionals and organizations that use its social network to broadcast videos in real-time. Called LinkedIn Live, the feature enables videos to be broadcast to a select group of individuals or to everyone publicly. Currently LinkedIn Live is available by invitation only.

The Top Reasons Consumers Follow and Engage With Brands on Social Media

A recent survey of 1,000 consumers revealed that over half of them follow retailers to learn about sales and new products. A little over one-third of consumers engage with a retailer’s content in exchange for discounts, or to share product or sale news with followers. Demographically, Millenials and Gen Xers are more likely than other groups to have Facebook, while members of Generation Z are more likely to use YouTube or Instagram than Facebook.

40% of LinkedIn Members Visit the Site Every Day, Engagement is Up 60%

LinkedIn has released new data to encourage social media managers to make the professional networking platform a priority. According to the company, it now has 610 million registered users, 40% of whom visit the site every day. Engagement is up 60%, and more than 130,000 articles are created on LinkedIn every week. The company’s data also reveals that a significant portion of business and industry leaders use LinkedIn, and that the site is utilized by 71% of people to make business decisions.

Facebook Introduces New Ways for Businesses to Communicate with Customers

Facebook is rolling out some changes that will make it easier for business and customers to communicate via social media. Business owners will soon be able to respond to Instagram direct messages from Facebook, and will also be able to participate in Facebook groups through their company pages rather than as individual users.

A PUG'S TALE

A Happy Hug Pug Birthday

Sheba, our original Hug Pug, celebrated her 15th birthday this February! Her doggie peeps Rio, MaoMao and Little Max attended the festivities and all received a piece of Sheba’s special birthday cake!

Legal Industry News

California Bar Adds Gender Identity and Sexual Orientation Questions to Member Survey

In an anonymous online survey, the California State Bar is asking lawyers about their sexual orientation and gender identity, as well as job satisfaction. Previous iterations of this survey have been more focused on issues such as practice type and size, but the current list of questions is aimed at identifying obstacles to retention and advancement of lawyers of diverse backgrounds in the profession.

PACER Should Be Free, According to Amicus Brief by Posner and Six Other Retired Judges

Amicus briefs filed in support of a class action lawsuit seeking to end PACER fees include the signatures of seven retired federal judges, including Richard Posner, formerly of the US Court of Appeals for the 7th Circuit. The judges’ brief argues that the system’s fees reduce the legitimacy of the courts as well as judicial transparency.

To Text, or Not to Text, Clients: An Ethical Question for a Technological Time

Lawyers who embrace the convenience of text messaging for client communications should be sure to do so in accordance with their professional ethical obligations. For example, the duty of competence includes technical competence, and the responsibility to ensure the security of any communication with a client. Lawyers using text messaging must also be mindful of the expectations that may create for instant client communications, which may not be feasible in all situations.

By Some Financial Measures, 2018 Was Best Year for Law Firms in a Decade

A growing demand for legal services, as well as higher billing rates and productivity, have led to conclusions that 2018 was a strong year for the legal industry. Net income and profits per equity partner were also up by 6.9 and 7.5 percent, respectively, making 2018 the best in a decade in those areas.
